description: A court ruling is blocking researchers from presenting a tech problem that could lead to car thefts.
title: Why stifling hackers may not be a good thing
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, July 31, 2013
contentencoded:
Dutch and English researchers have discovered a tech problem with Hondas, Volkswagens and Fiats that could lead to car thefts. But thanks to a court ruling in England their research may never be presented to the public.

Marcia Hofmann, a digital rights lawyer who is currently in Las Vegas at the Black Hat hacking conference, joins Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson to explain.
